id_and_class.summary: This perspective challenges materialism by positing that empirical evidence for psi phenomena (such as telepathy and psychokinesis) indicates the existence of a non-local mind. It suggests that consciousness is fundamentally primitive, possibly an 'ocean of consciousness,' from which energy and matter subsequently emerge, refuting the brain-based explanation of consciousness.
id_and_class.core_identity_tagline: Consciousness as Fundamental Ocean revealed by Psi

conceptual_ground.explanatory_identity_claim: Consciousness is identified as a fundamental, non-local 'ocean' of reality from which matter and energy emerge as derivative properties.
conceptual_ground.mind_body_relationship: Mind is ontologically prior to and causal of matter and energy; thus, the mind is not reducible to brain processes (non-substance dualism).
conceptual_ground.emergence_type: Not Applicable (Consciousness is Primitive). Note: Matter and energy are treated as emergent phenomena arising from consciousness.
conceptual_ground.subjectivity_and_intentionality: Subjectivity is primitive, inherent in consciousness; intentionality manifests as a causal power capable of affecting the physical world (force of will/psychokinesis).
conceptual_ground.qualia_account: Qualia are intrinsic properties of the fundamental 'ocean of consciousness' itself. (Justified: If consciousness is the fundamental substance, its qualitative feel must be intrinsic to that substance.)
conceptual_ground.ontological_commitments: Fundamental consciousness (non-local), energy, matter/physical world (emergent from consciousness), and objective reality of psi phenomena.
conceptual_ground.epistemic_access: Empirical (via controlled psi experiments and subsequent meta-analyses) and philosophical/inferential (using psi evidence to infer fundamental metaphysics).
conceptual_ground.constituents_and_structure: A non-local, undivided 'ocean of consciousness' which might operate based on quantum-oriented principles.

mechanism_and_dynamics.scope_of_consciousness: Phenomenal, Agency (intentionality/force of will), Non-local Cognition/Perception (divination).
mechanism_and_dynamics.distinctive_mechanism_or_principle: Causation via non-local effects, potentially quantum-oriented, stemming from the primitive nature of consciousness, enabling mindful intention to affect the physical world.
mechanism_and_dynamics.dynamics_of_emergence: Consciousness is static/primitive; the physical world dynamically emerges from this fundamental consciousness, and non-local effects (psi) are the observable manifestations of this underlying reality.
mechanism_and_dynamics.location_and_distribution: Non-local; distributed universally, likened to an 'ocean of consciousness.'
mechanism_and_dynamics.causation_and_functional_role: Consciousness is causally efficacious, allowing 'downward causation' where mindful intention (e.g., psychokinesis) influences physical reality, thereby challenging the causal closure of classical physics.
mechanism_and_dynamics.integration_or_binding: Integration is inferred to be inherent in the holistic, non-local 'ocean of consciousness,' linking individual minds through quantum-oriented relationships.
mechanism_and_dynamics.information_flow_or_representation: Information transfer, relevant to non-local perception (divination/clairvoyance), occurs outside the constraints of physical space-time due to the non-local nature of mind.
mechanism_and_dynamics.evolutionary_account: Not explicitly addressed in provided excerpts. (Justified: The focus is on fundamental ontology, placing consciousness outside traditional biological evolution.)
core_claims_and_evidence: Consciousness is fundamental and non-local, giving rise to energy and matter.
Psi phenomena (divination, force of will) are real and reliably evidenced by meta-analyses, demonstrating the existence of a non-local mind.
The evidence for psi is comparable in strength to established phenomena in mainstream psychology.
mechanism_and_dynamics.basis_of_belief_or_evidence_type: Empirical (meta-analyses of controlled experiments) and Philosophical/Metaphysical.

empirics_and_critiques.testability_status: Empirically Testable. The core arguments rely on repeatable (though controversial) experimental results from psi research.
known_empirical_interventions_or_tests: Meta-analyses of psi experiments (e.g., telepathy, remote viewing, precognition, psychokinesis)
empirics_and_critiques.criticisms_and_tensions: Strongly criticized by skeptics who claim psi effects are due to illusion, delusion, fraud, methodological flaws, statistical errors (Type I errors), or the 'existential impossibility' of psi phenomena. It requires abandoning the established causal closure of classical physics.
empirics_and_critiques.open_questions_and_limitations: The theoretical framework requires robust mechanisms to integrate quantum mechanics and non-locality with consciousness, and must overcome ongoing scientific skepticism regarding the reliability and interpretation of psi data.
empirics_and_critiques.ontological_coherence: Conditional Coherence. Highly coherent within a post-materialistic framework where consciousness is fundamental, but entirely incoherent under standard materialist assumptions (i.e., classical physics' causal closure).

AI_consciousness.rationale: If consciousness is derived from a fundamental 'ocean' accessible only through specific (likely biological or non-classical) pathways, AI systems' potential for consciousness depends entirely on whether they can access or embody this fundamental, non-local reality.

survival_beyond_death.rationale: By positing consciousness as non-local and fundamental, rather than solely generated by the brain, the model suggests consciousness (the 'ocean' or non-physical component) could persist after the physical body and brain dissolve.

meaning_and_purpose.rationale: The assertion that consciousness is the ultimate foundation of all reality implies an underlying metaphysical structure, providing a basis for ultimate cosmic meaning/purpose beyond purely humanistic construction.

virtual_immortality.rationale: If consciousness relies on a fundamental, non-physical, non-local component, duplicating the physical brain in a virtual substrate would necessarily fail to capture the essential conscious component required for true self-continuity.
